title: Firephotomedic
author: Firephotomedic
content: Good afternoon, recently I came into possession of 4 "Antminer" devices and to be honest I dont know anything about them and I am honestly just looking to sell them. I am not sure of what they go for and thats mainly the help im looking for. They are brand new still in the box with plastic and Styrofoam. the info in which I have is as followsModel 240-Zz Version Z15-jis there any other information thats needed?thanks again everyone

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: How did you come to possess them (seems odd to end up with something you don't know anything about)?Also what country are you in? If its somewhere where mining is profitible you're probably more likely to be able to sell them without paying for international shipping. I can't find many places that sell them though or list a price for them that seems legit, bitmain don't list them on their website either.

comments.author: Firephotomedic
comments.body: good afternoon sir, thank you for responding to my post. in all honesty they were delivered to me about 4 months ago on accident. the shipper was contacted multiple times they picked them up multiple times and kept bringing them back. There was never a shipping label, packing list, or receipt in any of the boxes  I am located in the USA.thank you in advance for any help

comments.author: RickDeckard
comments.body: That is a very weird situation - isn't there any information on the packages? Not even a logo from the seller? Can't you ask for details to the shipper as to whoever send them? Assuming current prices[1] you're looking at 24.000 € (excluding VAT) that someone paid and probably due to a typo in the address didn't received those units. Imagine that it was you - I'm sure you'll be very upset.At most I would once again approach the company that gave you the package to inquire further. When did you first receive these units?However, if you still do intend to sell the units despite all of this, you can do it right here in bitcointalk! You just have to post the ad in Marketplace -> Goods > Computer Hardware[2]. You can take some notes for the creation of the thread here[3]. You'll probably need to find an escrow for this deal considering the value that we're talking about.[1]https://www.antminerdistribution.com/antminer-z15/[2]https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=75.0[3]https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4576802.msg41268015#msg41268015

comments.author: LeGaulois
comments.body: HiThe model number you mention is for the Antminer Z15 (good for zcash, horizen, etc...)You can sell them on Ebay or Amazon easily, especially if they have never been used, and since you're from The U.S, Craiglist is an option to check. On Aliexpress, used Z15 machines are sold for about 5,000$ and more. On Bitmain it was sold brand new for like 8.000$Version   Z15Model No.   240ZCrypto Algorithm   EquiHashHashrate（KSol/s）   420Power on wall（Watt)   1510Power efficiency on wall @25°C (J/Ksol)   3.60Hardware Configuration    Network connection mode   RJ45 Ethernet 10/100MMiner Size (Length*Width*Height, w/o package), mm(1-1)   245*132.5*290Net weight, kg(2-1)   5.90

comments.author: Diplester6666
comments.body: Quote from: Firephotomedic on July 06, 2022, 06:54:15 PMGood afternoon, recently I came into possession of 4 "Antminer" devices and to be honest I dont know anything about them and I am honestly just looking to sell them. I am not sure of what they go for and thats mainly the help im looking for. They are brand new still in the box with plastic and Styrofoam. the info in which I have is as followsModel 240-Zz Version Z15-jis there any other information thats needed?thanks again everyoneWith just a little bit of Googling you'll be able to see that this miner works for Equihash algorithm that is used to mine Zcash, and goes for around $8000 in new condition.https://www.coinantminers.com/product/antminer-z15/If you do not want to get into mining yourself, your best bet is to sell it to someone for a little bit of discount.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Diplester6666 on July 08, 2022, 03:21:08 AMIf you do not want to get into mining yourself, your best bet is to sell it to someone for a little bit of discount.This is true given the fact that mining profitability has also dropped since on top of the buyer not being sure if they miners he is buying were attained in a legit way or illegally.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: Firephotomedic on July 06, 2022, 08:43:35 PMgood afternoon sir, thank you for responding to my post. in all honesty they were delivered to me about 4 months ago on accident. the shipper was contacted multiple times they picked them up multiple times and kept bringing them back. There was never a shipping label, packing list, or receipt in any of the boxes  I am located in the USA.thank you in advance for any helpIf indeed this story is true, then I did first of all say that you are indeed one lucky fellow.But I still find it difficult to come to terms of how someone possibly paid such a huge amount of money for this items and end up loosing them probably due to a misspelling in the address.If you are honest enough to say the truth here, I will advice you to continue to be honest and don't sell the items yet, try to reach to the courier company that shipped this item to you, inquire from them if the true owner of this items haven't reached out to them as to reasons why he or she has not received his or her goods, I believe there must be a away to reach out to the true of this items, waiting for 4 months is long enough I believe, but still give it 8 months more to total 1 year, if after 1 full year, you or the courier company still didn't find the true owner of the item, then I believe you are free to do whatever you want with it, sell them or use them, it's totally yours to decide.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Firephotomedic on July 06, 2022, 06:54:15 PMGood afternoon, recently I came into possession of 4 "Antminer" devices and to be honest I dont know anything about them and I am honestly just looking to sell them. Quote from: Firephotomedic on July 06, 2022, 08:43:35 PMin all honesty they were delivered to me about 4 months ago on accident. the shipper was contacted multiple times they picked them up multiple times and kept bringing them backI find this story of yours quite unconvincing, because it's hard to believe that someone can deliver something to you, even though it's more than obvious that it doesn't belong to you. Such valuable packages are not driven around without proper documentation and without a tracking number and delivered to random addresses. I would never receive such a package, and every honest person would do the same, so let the company that delivers the packages deal with that problem.It's up to you to decide what to do, but I would personally return it to the company that delivered it with a written request that the package not be delivered to you anymore because it doesn't belong to you.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on July 09, 2022, 02:41:33 PMI find this story of yours quite unconvincing, because it's hard to believe that someone can deliver something to you, even though it's more than obvious that it doesn't belong to you. Such valuable packages are not driven around without proper documentation and without a tracking number and delivered to random addresses. +1Maybe I am just too paranoid, but I am not buying that story. I mean, to get ~$30K worth of mining equipment by mistake and no one figuring it out yet? What is next, OP making the add saying that he is selling those miners now that he established (at least he will think that) his bs story.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on July 09, 2022, 02:51:46 PMQuote from: Lucius on July 09, 2022, 02:41:33 PMI find this story of yours quite unconvincing, because it's hard to believe that someone can deliver something to you, even though it's more than obvious that it doesn't belong to you. Such valuable packages are not driven around without proper documentation and without a tracking number and delivered to random addresses. +1Maybe I am just too paranoid, but I am not buying that story. I mean, to get ~$30K worth of mining equipment by mistake and no one figuring it out yet? What is next, OP making the add saying that he is selling those miners now that he established (at least he will think that) his bs story. No, I don't think you're too paranoid. There is nothing true in the OP's story, and I believe that it is most likely some kind of cheap scam attempt. It seems the OP is playing the innocent and naive, hoping that some greedy idiot will fall for it.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.created_time: July 09, 2022, 10:59:59 PMLast edit: July 10, 2022, 08:21:09 AM by Stalker22
comments.body: Op, for someone supposedly located in the USA, you seem to have quite a language issue. Not only do you have a vocabulary problem, you don't seem to know the basics of grammar and spelling. If you received something that does not belong to you, the best thing to do is return it to the rightful owner. It can be a very important sum of money for someone. Imagine that you are on the other side, and that you didn't get the product you paid for. I suggest that you should do what is right and explore all available options for returning miners instead of trying to sell them for personal profit.

comments.author: pawanjain
comments.body: Quote from: Firephotomedic on July 06, 2022, 06:54:15 PMGood afternoon, recently I came into possession of 4 "Antminer" devices and to be honest I dont know anything about them and I am honestly just looking to sell them. I am not sure of what they go for and thats mainly the help im looking for. They are brand new still in the box with plastic and Styrofoam. the info in which I have is as followsModel 240-Zz Version Z15-jis there any other information thats needed?thanks again everyoneIsn't it quite simple. Just search for your model of antminer online and find it's current price.According to that you can fix a price you want to sell for and then from the local borad enter your country's board.In the local marketplace section you can put up a post saying you want to sell these devices for this price.Interested people will reply to the post. You can also put the devices for sell in any app/website that your country has for marketplace.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: At this present era you don't to be ignorant of something before you enroll yourself, you have to make a proper research of the things before you have to engage on it. Even now you are seeking for a qualify and cogent direction on how you can as sell what is in your possession. You don't have to come here rather making a research from internet and you have a place you can sell it out and platforms that it's in their list. Secondly marketing of any items should be created directly to service board not in BH board.

comments.author: PrimeNumber7
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on July 09, 2022, 02:41:33 PMQuote from: Firephotomedic on July 06, 2022, 06:54:15 PMGood afternoon, recently I came into possession of 4 "Antminer" devices and to be honest I dont know anything about them and I am honestly just looking to sell them. Quote from: Firephotomedic on July 06, 2022, 08:43:35 PMin all honesty they were delivered to me about 4 months ago on accident. the shipper was contacted multiple times they picked them up multiple times and kept bringing them backI find this story of yours quite unconvincing, because it's hard to believe that someone can deliver something to you, even though it's more than obvious that it doesn't belong to you. Such valuable packages are not driven around without proper documentation and without a tracking number and delivered to random addresses. I would never receive such a package, and every honest person would do the same, so let the company that delivers the packages deal with that problem.I agree. If someone had purchased miners that ended up at the OP's address, they would presumably be trying to contact the seller, trying to find out where they are. Further, if someone had sold miners to someone, it would be unusual for them to be unresponsive to their customers, as the OP has claimed to be unable to get ahold of the sender.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: I have ordered from many many many many many sellers.Over seas sellers and USA sellers.I have had an ebay business since 2003I have mined since 2012I very likely have had 2500 packages sent to me since 2003.Two or three were never delivered and I had 2 errors in my favor . This is out of 2500 packagesMaybe 3000  packages.The errors were for a good router and for a good psu.I both cases I got a 2x shipmint ie two boxes not one.To get four 6000 plus packages sent which mean you owe over 7000 in import taxes is very hard to believe.I suggest you make sure you do not get stuck the 30% import tax due on them.good luck.
